attributes.action: Build a hospital in the newly established ‘City of Dunfermline’
attributes.additional_details:
My sister recently had sepsis and could have died, the treatment timeline would have been shortened if the ‘city’ had a hospital! 

Having to travel 14+ miles (28 miles round trip) to attend an accident and emergency department is ridiculous when you live in a city.
attributes.background: Consider the amount of houses being built v the need for more medical facilities in the City. Not having a hospital is going to result in more people dying - how can we be granted city status without an a and e department!

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
